sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Net-tools package contains the arp, hostname, ifconfig, netstat, plipconfig, rarp, route, and slattach programs.

sect3.title: arp
sect3.para: arp is used to manipulate the kernel's ARP cache, usually to add or delete an entry, or to dump the ARP cache.

sect3.title: hostname
sect3.para: hostname, with its symlinks domainname, dnsdomainname, nisdomainname, ypdomainname, and nodename, is used to set or show the system's hostname (or other, depending on the symlink used).

sect3.title: ifconfig
sect3.para: The ifconfig command is the general command used to configure network interfaces.

sect3.title: netstat
sect3.para: netstat is a multi-purpose tool used to print the network connections, routing tables, interface statistics, masquerade connections, and multicast memberships.

sect3.title: plipconfig
sect3.para: plipconfig is used to fine-tune the PLIP device parameters, hopefully making it faster.

sect3.title: rarp
sect3.para: Akin to the arp program, the rarp program manipulates the system's RARP table.

sect3.title: route
sect3.para: route is the general utility which is used to manipulate the IP routing table.

sect3.title: slattach
sect3.para: slattach attaches a network interface to a serial line, i.e.. puts a normal terminal line into one of several "network" modes.
